alert.note: Alert for Canadian (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Oklahoma, including the following counties, Canadian, Kingfisher, Logan and Oklahoma. * WHEN...Until 815 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 615 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northwestern Oklahoma City, western Edmond, Guthrie, Yukon, Bethany, Warr Acres, The Village, Piedmont, Nichols Hills, Cashion, Cedar Valley, Cimarron City, Forest Park, Woodlawn Park, Lake Aluma, Navina, Seward, Richland, Wiley Post Airport and Downtown Edmond. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
